ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Another Question
ygData.msgSnippet: I was never worried that you were. :-)  Just thought I d give the reasons why this is a no-no. Best, Suzanne ... From: Brangvyne Accampo To:
ygData.messageBody:
I was never worried that you were. :-)  Just thought I'd give the reasons why this is a no-no.
Best,
Suzanne
----- Original Message -----
From: Brangvyne Accampo
To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 7:36 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Another Question

Salutations Suzanne!

Thank you for the response. I was afraid that was what
the answer was, and in case anyone wonders no I'm not
looking for an illegal way to do it. I tend to obey
laws even when they are dumb ones to my way of
thinking.

Hugs
:o)
Bran

--- "Suzanne J. Johnson" <katannah@...> wrote:
> You cannot do this legally.  You are required to
> have a unique CD key for each account, and a unique
> account for each player, or you violate copyright
> laws.  Additionally, you can't have two characters
> from the same account online at the same time
> (legally).
>
> Best Regards,
> Aelwesara Cuthalion
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Brangvyne Accampo
>   To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 4:48 PM
>   Subject: [EQ_women] Another Question
>
>
>   Salutations All!
>
>   Does anyone know if I have two computers in my
> house
>   with seperate axcess to EQ if I could run the same
>   copy of EQ on both? Assuming I have access for
> both to
>   the internet at the same time which I dont but
> soon
>   will could I run the same copy of EQ at the same
> time
>   and have two characters online controled by two
>   people? Or, would I have to have two paid accounts
> to
>   do this?
>
>   Just wondering if anyone might know the answer to
>   that. If no one knows the answer for sure does
> anyone
>   have any suggestions of places to start looking
> for an
>   answer, or who I should contact?
>
>   :o)
>   Bran
